page.title: 01DUNTOCHER,HARDGATE,FAIFLEY.
page.content: This area is part of Clydebank and District,situated north of the town centre.Duntocher and Hardgate are much older than Clydebank itself but Faifley was built after the war.There are approx. 16000 inhabitants.To the north are the Kilpatrick Hills and to the south the A82 to Loch Lomond separates it from the rest of Clydebank.To the east lies Bearsden and to the west Old Kilpatrick.The only access to the town centre is by Kilbowie Road. The area is mainly residential with both private and local authority housing.About half the land is open space,farmland or moor.Most inhabitants travel to work as they are within easy reach of Glasgow which also has good shopping facilities.Loch Lomond is the most popular recreational area.
